data.title: Top 15 Trucking Magazines & Publications in 2024
data.meta_description: Top 15 Trucking Magazines ⋅ 1. Overdrive ⋅ 2. Truckers News ⋅ 3. FleetOwner » For the Driver ⋅ 4. New Zealand Trucking ⋅ 5. Fleetwatch ⋅ 6. Trucking Magazine ⋅ 7. Land Line ⋅ 8. Transport Topics
data.text:
1. Overdrive

Overdrive Magazine, established in 1961, is a premier publication dedicated to the American trucking industry. As 'The Voice of the American Trucker,' it delivers essential news, insights, and trends for owner-operators and professional truck drivers. The magazine covers a wide range of topics, including industry regulations, equipment, and lifestyle features. Under the leadership of Editor-in-Chief Todd Dills, Overdrive remains a vital resource for truckers seeking to stay informed and connected within the trucking community.

Publication overdriveonline.com

Facebook Followers 406.6KTwitter Followers 29.4KInstagram Followers 10.4K Frequency 5 posts / week

2. Truckers News

Truckers News is a leading publication dedicated to providing vital information and updates for the trucking community. The magazine covers a wide range of topics essential to truck drivers, including industry news, safety tips, and lifestyle articles. With a commitment to supporting the professional and personal lives of truckers, Truckers News offers valuable insights and practical advice to help drivers navigate their careers and stay informed about industry trends. The publication also highlights stories of inspiration and innovation within the trucking world, making it a trusted resource for truckers across the nation.

Publication truckersnews.com

Facebook Followers 207.3KTwitter Followers 25.2K Frequency 8 posts / month

3. FleetOwner » For the Driver

FleetOwner magazine is a premier resource for commercial truck fleet executives and maintenance managers, offering in-depth information on operations, vehicle maintenance, industry regulations, and information-management technology. Serving a large base of professionals monthly, it boasts the largest audience of commercial truck fleet executives in the industry. The editorial team, led by Kevin Jones (Editorial Director) and Josh Fisher (Editor-in-Chief), ensures high-quality, relevant content.

Publication fleetowner.com

Facebook Followers 12.5KTwitter Followers 31.8K Frequency 9 posts / day

4. New Zealand Trucking

NZ Trucking is the definitive source for trucking news and industry updates in New Zealand, catering to professionals in the trucking and logistics sectors. It offers extensive coverage of the latest developments, regulatory changes, and technological advancements impacting the industry. The magazine features in-depth articles, insightful commentaries, and profiles of key industry figures. The editorial team, including seasoned contributors like Gavin Myers and Dave McCoid, ensures comprehensive and timely information. With a focus on business insights, health and safety, and operational tips, NZ Trucking is an essential read for anyone involved in the trucking industry.

Publication nztrucking.co.nz

Facebook Followers 75.8KInstagram Followers 3.1K Frequency 3 posts / day

5. Fleetwatch

FleetWatch Magazine, launched in 1993, initially served as a fleet risk management journal and has evolved into a comprehensive trucking industry publication. It focuses on issues pertinent to modern-day truckers, such as fleet management, vehicle maintenance, driver health, and road safety. The magazine is dedicated to independent and objective journalism, advocating for the industry while seeking solutions to key challenges. Notably, FleetWatch has been recognized as South Africa's Best Transport Magazine six times and has won 60 awards for journalistic excellence. The magazine, managed by Publisher and Managing Editor Patrick O'Leary, is a vital resource for transport professionals and industry stakeholders.

Publication fleetwatch.co.za

Facebook Followers 32.1KTwitter Followers 2.5KInstagram Followers 1.1K Frequency 4 posts / week

6. Trucking Magazine

Trucking Magazine is a leading publication in the road transport industry, catering to all levels from operators to drivers. It provides comprehensive coverage of industry developments, alternative fuels, legislation, and licensing. The magazine also features opinion pieces, success stories, and legal advice relevant to the sector. Key editorial figures include Simon Hastelow, Pipp Dunn, and Catherine Crockart, who bring extensive experience and passion to the publication. Trucking Magazine, part of Kelsey Media Ltd., aims to engage and inform professionals through traditional advertising, creative solutions, and brand partnerships.

Publication truckingmag.co.uk

Facebook Followers 157.1KTwitter Followers 12.3K Frequency 5 posts / week

7. Land Line

Land Line Magazine, established in 1975 by the Owner-Operator Independent Drivers Association (OOIDA), is a premier source for trucking news and insights. Originally founded to provide trucking industry news that accurately represented drivers' perspectives, it has grown into a trusted resource for professional truckers. The editorial team includes notable contributors such as Jami Jones, Mark Schremmer, Keith Goble, Tyson Fisher, SJ Munoz, and Erin Wisdom-Watson. Land Line also extends its reach through Land Line Now, a popular radio show and podcast available on Sirius XM.

Publication landline.media

Facebook Followers 40.6KTwitter Followers 32K Frequency 4 posts / day

8. Transport Topics

Transport Topics, a leading source in trucking and freight transportation news, delivers crucial information to industry professionals. With its flagship weekly print edition, comprehensive digital content, and multimedia platforms like the RoadSigns podcast and Transport Topics Radio on SiriusXM, it ensures readers are well-informed about industry developments. The editorial team, including Joe Howard (Executive Editor), Eugene Mulero, Michael Freeze, and Seth Clevenger, provide insightful analysis and breaking news, making it an essential resource for decision-makers in the trucking and logistics sector.

Publication ttnews.com

Facebook Followers 14KTwitter Followers 45.6K Frequency 3 posts / week

9. HDT Magazine

Heavy Duty Trucking's 'On the Road' blog, part of the leading platform Trucking Info, offers in-depth insights into the commercial truck industry. Managed by experienced editors, the blog covers various topics including fleet management, equipment, safety, and environmental issues. Established by Bobit Business Media, Heavy Duty Trucking has been a trusted source for trucking professionals since the early 1900s, providing award-winning journalism and analysis. The blog serves as a vital resource for industry leaders, offering updates and expert opinions to help navigate the complexities of the trucking industry.

Publication truckinginfo.com

Facebook Followers 11.9KTwitter Followers 35.7K Frequency 16 posts / week Since Aug 2010

10. CDLLife

CDLLife News is a premier source of information for the trucking community, offering the latest updates on industry news, regulations, crime reports, and entertainment relevant to truck drivers. The magazine covers a wide range of topics from real-time incident reports and legislative changes to human interest stories and technological advancements. It aims to keep truckers informed and connected with the broader trucking world.The magazine's commitment to timely and relevant content is evident through its comprehensive coverage.

Publication cdllife.com/news

Facebook Followers 467.5KTwitter Followers 9K Frequency 10 posts / week

11. Truck News

Truck News Magazine is a leading publication dedicated to the Canadian trucking industry, providing the latest news, in-depth analysis, and expert opinions. With a focus on industry trends, regulatory updates, and technological advancements, Truck News serves as a crucial resource for trucking professionals. The magazine features contributions from experienced journalists like James Menzies and Angela Splinter, ensuring high-quality and relevant content. Known for its comprehensive coverage, Truck News continues to support and inform the trucking community through its print and digital platforms?

Publication trucknews.com

Facebook Followers 6.9KTwitter Followers 28.8K Frequency 3 posts / day Since Jan 2006

12. FleetOwner

FleetOwner is a leading publication serving executives and maintenance management of commercial truck fleets operating five or more vehicles. Providing business insights on operations, vehicle maintenance, industry regulations, and information-management technology, FleetOwner engages over half a million commercial vehicle professionals monthly. Key team members include Editorial Director Kevin Jones, Editor-in-Chief Josh Fisher, and Senior Editor Jade Brasher. Part of Endeavor Business Media, FleetOwner connects industry stakeholders through a variety of platforms, ensuring comprehensive coverage of the commercial truck and trailer marketplace.

Publication fleetowner.com

Facebook Followers 8.5KTwitter Followers 31.8K
